Message.Title: Stock purchases
Message.Msg: Bayer AG at 81.95 €/share -- allocation 3.5% BASF SE at 72.15 €/share -- allocation 3.5% Residential Real estate {Berlin, Stuttgart, Munich, Frankfurt, Ludwigshafen, Ruhr} -- allocation 89% 3-month German t-bills -- allocation 3% euro cash -- allocation 1% About half of Bayer's operations are focused on the war on fossil fuels in the area of bio-fuels and materials sciences. BASF is very extensively engaged in the war effort as well. In the past they were IG Farben
Interesting

Message.Title: Weekly Natural Gas Storage Report for week ending June 7, 2013
Message.Msg: Weekly Natural Gas Storage Report for week ending June 7, 2013 Released: June 13, 2013 at 10:30 a.m. Summary Working gas in storage was 2,347 Bcf as of Friday, June 7, 2013, according to EIA estimates. This represents a net increase of 95 Bcf from the previous week. Stocks were 587 Bcf less than last year at this time and 58 Bcf below the 5-year average of 2,405 Bcf. In the East Region, stocks were 102 Bcf below the 5-year average following net injections of 57 Bcf. Stocks in the Producing Region were 2 Bcf below the 5-year average of 915 Bcf after a net injection of 25 Bcf. Stocks in the West Region were 46 Bcf above the 5-year average after a net addition of 13 Bcf. At 2,347 Bcf, total working gas is within the 5-year historical range. CHARTS... irDOTeiaDOTgov/ngs/ngs.html

Message.Title: Arkansas and Our money
Message.Msg: Looks like the state of Arkansas is jumping on the bandwagon to try to take other peoples money for free. They should go to all bioenergy and set in the dark.

It's not just Arkansas, it's also the Justice Dept. Exxon has been vilified by both states and the national government for years who take every opportunity to sue and heap penalties on Exxon. A pipeline burst and dumped 18,000 gallons of oil. Exxon responded immediately to clean it up, but that wasn't enough of an effort apparently. A gas line explosion in California a few years ago killed several people, but you didn't see the state and national government sueing the gas company over that. Exxon has been singled out as the ultimate corporate bad guy and no matter what they do following an accident, the lawsuits start flying. Perhaps Exxon should shut down all their pipelines and refineries for a month and see what effect that has on the governments tax collection.
